name: Aquatic Reincarnation (Shackles)
description: Custom reincarnation table for aquatic creatures in the Shackles region, designed for Sahuagin Druids

results.details: Common throughout the Fever Sea; insular reef-kin and current-riders.
Reef- or kelp-dwelling elves; wary of surface politics.
Azlanti-descended survivors, culturally divided between land and sea.
Nomadic shoal-folk; proud traders and fisher-warriors.
Octopus-blooded mystics; unsettling but respected for occult insight.
Rare elven-appearing mutants bred for infiltration and espionage.
Solitary sharklike hunters; often exiles or renegades.
Former aboleth thralls, biologically warped but mentally autonomous.
Extraplanar sea-knights; culturally hostile to sahuagin and pirates alike.
Orcs descended from escaped sahuagin slaves; one traditional orc racial trait replaced with a swim speed and aquatic adaptation.
Shackles-born sailors; replace elven bonuses with Skill Focus (Seamanshipâ€”pirate or sailor) and Swim, and replace longbow proficiency with rapier, cutlass, or scimitar.
Changelings bound to Besmara; they do not undergo unwilling hag or sea-hag transformation so long as they remain in the Pirate Queen's service.
Goblin-kin twisted by brine and cruelty; dangerous, cunning, and feared.
Myth-haunted eelfolk; a diminished lineage rather than a full legendary specimen.
Abyssal anglerfolk; reincarnation feels ominous and portentous.
Pirate stock, reef-runner, or freed slave of the Fever Sea.
Must plausibly exist in the Shackles or surrounding seas.
May require rare reagents, divine favor, or significant roleplay consequences.
